intro: Hoplophytum unispicatum, commonly known as the single-spined hoplophytum, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, also known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its fleshy, cylindrical stems and small, spiny leaves. The plant produces vibrant yellow flowers during the warmer months, typically from late spring to early summer. It is well adapted to arid environments, storing water in its thick, fleshy stems to survive in dry conditions. Due to its unique appearance and low maintenance requirements, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
